Disease.content:
Please identify the "Disease" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: CONCLUSIONS : Our results indicate that trazodone at 2 . 5 - 20 mg / kg does not block pre - and postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors , while at 30 , 40 and 50 mg / kg it blocks postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors .

Let's think step by step.

| Disease |
| --- |
| D2 DA receptors |
| postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors |

Note: The term "D2 DA receptors" refers to a specific type of receptor in the brain that plays a role in the regulation of movement and motivation. "Postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors" refers to a specific subtype of D2 DA receptors located in the striatum, a region of the brain involved in motor control and reward processing.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Disease" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Disease".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Sure, here's the updated table with the valid entities that clearly refer to "Disease":

| Disease |
| --- |
| D2 DA receptors |

The term "postsynaptic striatal D2 DA receptors" does not clearly refer to a disease, so it has been removed from the table.
